author: Special Correspondent
text:
Much like their Telangana counterparts, legislators of Andhra Pradesh are in for a major salary hike, if the recommendations made by the Amenities Committee of the legislature are accepted.

The panel has recommended that the salary of the legislators be increased from Rs. 95,000 to Rs. 1.5 lakh a month. It recommended that the amount paid towards amenities, including house rent allowance, be doubled from Rs. 25,000 a month to Rs. 50,000.

The committee, headed by Assembly Speaker Kodela Sivaprasada Rao, with Finance and Legislative Affairs Minister Yanamala Ramakrishnudu as its special invitee, is learnt to have recommended that the pension paid to legislators be doubled from Rs. 25,000 to Rs. 50,000 a month.

A section of the panel members is learnt to have insisted that the panel recommend a pay hike on a par with the one made by its Telangana counterpart.

The Telangana Amenities Committee, in its recent report, recommended a hike in the salary of legislators from Rs. 95,000 to Rs. 3.5 lakh a month.

The Finance Minister, however, is learnt to have shot down the proposal citing the precarious financial health of the State, but promised that the request would be considered once the situation improved.

The committee had considered the request of the members to enhance the quantum of car loan from the Rs. 10 lakh to Rs. 40 lakh.

In addition, the committee is understood to have recommended that the allowance for purchase of books and other periodicals be increased to Rs. 1 lakh for the five-year term.

title: Hefty pay hike awaits Andhra legislators
